User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the system.

role.description: Role of the user (superadmin, admin, comun).

areas.description: List of areas the user belongs to. (Reference to Area). Required for admin role.

modules.description: List of modules the admin user has access to.

area.description: Area the user belongs to (for 'comun' role). (Reference to Area)

isActive.description: Indicates if the user is active.

creationDate.description: Date and time the user was created.

createdBy.description: User ID of the user who created this user. (Reference to User)

lastAccess.description: Date and time of the user's last access.

fechaIngreso.description: The user's start date in the company.

diasContrato.description: Duration of the contract in days (if applicable).

avatarUrl.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

monthlyPoints.description: Points accumulated by the user during the current month for recognition programs.

recognitions.description: List of recognitions or awards received by the user, e.g., 'employee_of_the_month_YYYY-MM'.

Area.title: Area
Area.description: Represents an area within the organization.

id.description: Unique identifier for the area (service, cocina, limpieza, almacen, equipos, administracion).

responsible.description: User ID of the user responsible for the area. (Reference to User)

isActive.description: Indicates if the area is active.

Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task in the system.

area.description: Area the task belongs to. (Reference to Area)

assignedTo.description: User ID of the user assigned to the task. (Reference to User)

createdBy.description: User ID of the user who created the task. (Reference to User)

status.description: Status of the task (pendiente, en-progreso, completada, verificada, rechazada).

priority.description: Priority of the task (baja, media, alta, urgente).

periodicity.description: Periodicity of the task (diaria, semanal, quincenal, mensual, unica).

creationDate.description: Date and time the task was created.

dueDate.description: Date and time the task is due.

completionDate.description: Date and time the task was completed.

nextExecution.description: Date and time of the next execution for recurring tasks.

estimatedTime.description: Estimated time for the task in minutes.

isRecurring.description: Indicates if the task is recurring.

parentId.description: Task ID of the parent task for recurring tasks. (Reference to Task)

qualityScore.description: Supervisor's rating of the task quality (1-5).

effortScore.description: Supervisor's rating of the effort put in (1-5).

Statistic.title: Statistic
Statistic.description: Represents statistics for a given period.

monthlyTrend.description: Monthly trend percentage change vs previous month.

criticalAreas.description: Area IDs of critical areas with lower efficiency. (Reference to Area)

featuredUsers.description: User IDs of featured users with higher efficiency. (Reference to User)

Evidence.title: Evidence
Evidence.description: Represents photo evidence for a task.

uploadDate.description: Date and time the photo was uploaded.

userId.description: User ID who uploaded the photo. (Reference to User)

Comment.title: Comment
Comment.description: Represents a comment on a task.

userId.description: User ID who made the comment. (Reference to User)

date.description: Date and time the comment was made.

InventoryItem.title: Inventory Item
InventoryItem.description: Represents an item in the inventory.

id.description: Unique identifier for the inventory item.

codigo.description: Unique business logic identifier for the item (e.g., CAR-001, VIV-001).

categoriaId.description: Category of the item (carnes, viveres, etc.).

cantidad.description: Current quantity in stock, measured in 'unidadReceta'.

unidadReceta.description: Unit of measure for recipes (kg, g, lt, ml, unidad, etc.).

unidadCompra.description: Unit of measure for purchasing (caja, paquete, etc.).

stockMinimo.description: Minimum stock level in 'unidadReceta' before reorder warning.

fechaCreacion.description: Date the item was first added.

ultimaActualizacion.description: Last time the item was updated.

InventoryTransaction.title: Inventory Transaction
InventoryTransaction.description: Records a movement (entry or exit) of an inventory item.

quantity.description: The quantity of items moved, in 'unidadReceta'.

reason.description: Reason for the transaction (e.g., 'Uso en Producci√≥n', 'Vencimiento', 'Compra').

destinationArea.description: For 'salida', the area where the item was sent (e.g., 'cocina').

Menu.title: Menu
Menu.description: Represents a planned menu for a specific date.

date.description: The date for which the menu is planned.

pax.description: Number of people (comensales) the menu is planned for.

items.description: List of menu items for this menu.

MenuItem.title: Menu Item
MenuItem.description: Represents a single dish or item within a menu.

id.description: Unique identifier for the menu item.

category.description: Category of the dish (e.g., entrada, proteico).

ingredients.description: List of ingredients required for this dish.

Ingredient.title: Ingredient
Ingredient.description: Represents an ingredient required for a menu item.

AttendanceRecord.title: Attendance Record
AttendanceRecord.description: Represents a single attendance record for a user.

userId.description: The ID of the user this record belongs to.

status.description: The status of the attendance for that day.

leaveType.description: If the status is a leave of absence, this specifies the type.

DayOff.title: Day Off
DayOff.description: Represents a planned day off for a user for a specific week.

id.description: Unique identifier, usually in the format {userId}_{weekStartDate}.

userId.description: The ID of the user this day off belongs to.

weekStartDate.description: The start date of the week (Monday) for which this day off is planned (YYYY-MM-DD).

dayOff.description: The day of the week for the day off (0=Monday, 1=Tuesday, ..., 5=Saturday).

PeerReview.title: Peer Review
PeerReview.description: Represents a peer-to-peer review on a specific task.

reviewerId.description: User ID of the person giving the review.

revieweeId.description: User ID of the person being reviewed.

taskId.description: The task associated with this review.

rating.description: The peer's rating of the task execution.

comment.description: An optional comment from the peer.

date.description: Date and time the review was submitted.

EvaluationCriterion.title: Evaluation Criterion
EvaluationCriterion.description: Defines a single editable parameter for employee evaluations.

description.description: Explanation of what this criterion measures.

maxPoints.description: The maximum points that can be awarded for this criterion.

isActive.description: Whether this criterion is currently used in evaluations.

MonthlyEvaluation.title: Monthly Evaluation
MonthlyEvaluation.description: Stores the results of a user's monthly performance evaluation.

period.description: The evaluation period in YYYY-MM format.

totalScore.description: The sum of all scores for the period.

evaluatorId.description: The user ID of the person who conducted the evaluation.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support a task management system with role-based access control. It prioritizes authorization independence through denormalization and structural segregation.  

**Authorization Independence (Denormalization):**
*   `tasks` collection: The `area` and `assignedTo` fields are present in each task document. This denormalization allows security rules to validate access based on the user's role, the task's assigned area, and the assigned user without needing to perform expensive `get()` operations to retrieve the area or user details from other collections.  The inclusion of `createdBy` also allows for tracing and potential access control based on task creator.

**Structural Segregation:**
*   User data (`users` collection) is separated from task data (`tasks` collection).  
*   Area definitions (`areas` collection) are separate from both users and tasks.
*   Configuration data (`configuration` collection) is separate. This ensures that different types of data with varying access requirements are not mixed in the same collection.

**Access Modeling:**
*   **Private Data:** The `users` collection follows a path-based ownership model (`/users/{userId}`).

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
*   Secure `list` operations for tasks are supported because each task document contains the `assignedTo` field. Rules can efficiently filter tasks based on the authenticated user's ID.

**Invariants:**
*   The structure supports invariants like ownership (through `createdBy` and `assignedTo` in the `tasks` collection) and timestamps (through `creationDate`, `dueDate`, `completionDate` in the `tasks` collection).

**Additional Notes:**
*   The `statistics` collection is designed to store aggregated data, which can be updated via backend processes. Access to this collection is restricted to admins and superadmins.
*   The `evidence` and `comments` subcollections are intentionally avoided to minimize read costs when accessing task data. Instead, `evidenceIds` and `commentIds` are used in the `Task` entity to store references to `Evidence` and `Comment` entities which are stored as top-level collections. The `Evidence` collection denormalizes the `taskId` to allow performant security rules.
*   The `configuration` collection allows storing application-wide settings.
